Name: The Old House
Curators Note: They have been around for a long time. They now also have the most beautiful bakery inside. The food is amazing. Try the filter coffee flavored ice cream. It will change your life. The chocolate is good too.
Recommended Time: Anytime of the day is the best time to go here. It's never a disappointment.

Name: Minimal Coffee
Curators Note: My fav coffee pace in Mysore. It a perfect little place. Take your coffee to go and walk around the neighbourhood. Get some coffee beans too.

Name: White Teak
Curators Note: My second fav coffee place. Love the vibe. I also have a special table here where I have broken up with 3 people so now it is my break up table.
Must Try: Banoffee pie, any kind of eggs on the breakfast menu, orange citrus coffee, iced latte, herb garlic fries.
Recommended Time: I really enjoy breakfast and dinner time here.

Name: Mysore Palace
Curators Note: The iconic Mysore Palace is a stunning example of Indo-Saracenic architecture. A must-visit landmark that showcases the grandeur of the Wodeyar dynasty.
Must Try: Visit during the evening when the palace is illuminated with thousands of lights.
Timings: 10 am - 5:30 pm; Sunday evening 7 pm - 8 pm for illumination
Trivia: The palace was commissioned by King Krishnaraja Wodeyar IV in 1897. It took 15 years to complete. The palace is built in the Indo-Saracenic style and blends Hindu Rajput and Mughal architectural elements.
